intro: Helicteres binhthuanensis, commonly known as Binh Thuan helicteres, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
